original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 328.65/70 to the US dollar, bond yields stable
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 328.65/70 to the US dollar on Thursday, from 328.50/65 the previous day, dealers said.
The Colombo All Share Index opened up 0.14 percent, or 14.68 points, at 10,562. The S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was up 0.30 percent, or 9.07 points at 2,990.
A bond maturing on 01.08.2026 was quoted stable at 14.30/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted at 14.55/60 percent from 14.45/65 percent. (Colombo/Nov23/2023)
